item.description:
Cross-posted with the Boston Predictive Analytics group: http://www.meetup.com/Boston-Predictive-Analytics/events/72068092/

**Important**
If you are a foreign national, please list your name here in order to comply with MITRE's security requirements: http://bit.ly/NEH5Rm

 

Ted is one of the primary persons behind Mahout, and will be here to go into more detail as to its capabilities. Co-hosting with the Hadoop group.  Many thanks to Macy of MITRE and Jo from MapR for hosting and coordinating this event!  I copied and pasted this from a London Meetup in May which Ted spoke:

What is Mahout? Mahout's goal is to build scalable machine learning libraries

Mahout supports mainly four use cases:

  1. Recommendation mining takes users' behavior and from that tries to find items users might like.
  2. Clustering takes e.g. text documents and groups them into groups of topically related documents.
  3. Classification learns from exisiting categorized documents what documents of a specific category look like and is able to assign unlabelled documents to the (hopefully) correct category.
  4. Frequent itemset mining takes a set of item groups (terms in a query session, shopping cart content) and identifies, which individual items usually appear together.

 

 

*** Please note this is in the 'burbs, and not on a direct commuter rail line, and so for folks without a car, please email me, or post a note in your rsvp, so that car pooling might help out.
item.name: Ted Dunning
